adventure_overview: Taking turns and following the rules of the game is the lesson behind this fun Adventure as Tigers play by the rules. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

requirements.text: Play at least two different games by yourself; one may be a video game.

activities.name: Disc Golf and Soccer Golf
activities.description: Set up a golf course to play disc and soccer golf.

activities.name: Scout Life Games and Puzzles
activities.description: Cub Scouts play a video game on the Scout Life Magazine website and complete a crossword puzzle.

activities.name: Seven Up and Indoor Bowling
activities.description: Two fun games that only take one player, indoor bowling and seven up.

requirements.text: Play a board game or another inside game with one or more members of your den or family.

activities.name: Den Game Time
activities.description: Members of the den bring their favorite board or card game to play.

requirements.text: With other members of your den or family, invent a game, or change the rules of a game you know, and play the game.

activities.name: Checkers with a Twist
activities.description: Change the rules to checkers by allowing another turn if you take another players checker.

activities.name: My Cub Scout Game
activities.description: Make a board game based on Cub Scouting.

requirements.text: Play a team game with your den or family.

activities.name: Tiger Balloon Volleyball
activities.description: Play a game of balloon volleyball.
